title: Warnings signs for Biden Jewish support as war in Gaza drags on and antisemitism rises
message:
Still, conversations about a possible drift toward Donald Trump, though, are evident in the several Jewish elected Democratic leaders who grimaced and ducked when asked by CNN to discuss their sense of Jewish support for Biden.
Talking with Jewish voters in Michigan, “I’ve had a couple of people say point blank, ‘How could any Jew vote for a Democrat?’” said Troy Zukowski, the West Michigan chair of the Michigan Jewish Democrats.
The president does have some key Jewish voices of support in important places.
Trump’s support among Jewish voters in 2020, at 30% according to Associated Press exit polls, was the highest for a Republican presidential candidate in decades.
The expected central theme of that effort, according to one of the people involved, will be: As a Jewish American, do you feel safer than you did four years ago?
event_breakdown:
1. A swastika was drawn on the window of a home in Miami Beach, FL.
2. Anti-Semitic graffiti was written on the front of a Miami Beach home.
3. A swastika and the words "white power" were spray painted on a building in Miami Beach, FL.

[Antisemitic Murals in Upstate New York, United States, "The Anti-Defamation League has renewed calls to remove several antisemitic murals that have been staples of Route 81 for decades."]
[Antisemitic Incidents in New York City, United States, "Two recent antisemitic incidents in New York City showed a shocking disregard for the safety and well-being of the Jewish community.", "In Brooklyn, a man was randomly attacked and called antisemitic slurs leaving many in the Jewish community to feel unsafe."]

title: Warnings signs for Biden Jewish support as war in Gaza drags on and antisemitism rises
message:
Alarm is rising in Democratic circles that the turmoil set off by the October 7 attack by Hamas and Israel’s bloody war launched in response is becoming yet another weight on President Joe Biden’s reelection, with warning signs flashing over Jewish voters’ support for the president.
Talking with Jewish voters in Michigan, “I’ve had a couple of people say point blank, ‘How could any Jew vote for a Democrat?’” said Troy Zukowski, the West Michigan chair of the Michigan Jewish Democrats.
The president does have some key Jewish voices of support in important places.
Trump’s support among Jewish voters in 2020, at 30% according to Associated Press exit polls, was the highest for a Republican presidential candidate in decades.
The expected central theme of that effort, according to one of the people involved, will be: As a Jewish American, do you feel safer than you did four years ago?
event_breakdown:
1. On April 21, 2022, a swastika was found  on a billboard in Hollywood, FL. Police were called and are investigating the incident.
2. In January 2022, swastika graffiti was found on a bus stop  in New York City. The graffiti was removed, but the incident is being investigated as a hate crime.
3. In February 2022, swastika graffiti was found on a building  in the village of Silver Lake, WA. The graffiti was removed, but the incident is being investigated as a hate crime.
4. In February 2022, swastika graffiti was found on a building  in the village of Heuvelton, NY. The graffiti was removed, but the incident is being investigated as a hate crime.
5. On April 3, 2022, a swastika was carved into a tree in front of Seattle Central College . The graffiti was removed, but the incident is being investigated as a hate crime.

title: Warnings signs for Biden Jewish support as war in Gaza drags on and antisemitism rises
message:
Washington CNN —Alarm is rising in Democratic circles that the turmoil set off by the October 7 attack by Hamas and Israel’s bloody war launched in response is becoming yet another weight on President Joe Biden’s reelection, with warning signs flashing over Jewish voters’ support for the president.
Talking with Jewish voters in Michigan, “I’ve had a couple of people say point blank, ‘How could any Jew vote for a Democrat?’” said Troy Zukowski, the West Michigan chair of the Michigan Jewish Democrats.
The president does have some key Jewish voices of support in important places.
Trump’s support among Jewish voters in 2020, at 30% according to Associated Press exit polls, was the highest for a Republican presidential candidate in decades.
The expected central theme of that effort, according to one of the people involved, will be: As a Jewish American, do you feel safer than you did four years ago?

message:
Still, conversations about a possible drift toward Donald Trump, though, are evident in the several Jewish elected Democratic leaders who grimaced and ducked when asked by CNN to discuss their sense of Jewish support for Biden.
Talking with Jewish voters in Michigan, “I’ve had a couple of people say point blank, ‘How could any Jew vote for a Democrat?’” said Troy Zukowski, the West Michigan chair of the Michigan Jewish Democrats.

event_breakdown: 1. A synagogue in Irvine, California, was defaced with graffiti reading "F— Jews." The Irvine Police Department is investigating the incident and treating it as a hate crime. 2. In New York, a group of people gathered around a kosher restaurant and began chanting "Jews back to Israel" and "Hamas is going to kill all of you." 3. In Berlin, vandals set fire to a Hanukkah menorah. 4. In London, a group of men physically assaulted a Jewish man and shouted anti-Semitic slurs at him. 5. In Jerusalem, a gunman opened fire on a bus, killing two Jewish passengers and wounding several others. The Israeli government labeled the attack an act of terrorism.
